title: Amid Ruins and Explosions, Some Ukrainians Refuse to Leave Home
description: In Avdiivka, as in Bakhmut and other devastated places on the front lines, most residents left long ago, but there are holdouts.

title: Kamala Harris, at Former Slave Port in Ghana, Ties Past to Present
description: The vice president leaned into her heritage during a three-nation trip to Africa to strengthen U.S. relations on the continent.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: China’s Billions in Bailouts
description: Also, a shake-up at Alibaba and a rare glimpse at a ruined city in Ukraine.

title: Russian Girl Sent to Orphanage After Father Criticizes War
description: Rights activists worry that the separation of a teenage girl and her father after they criticized the war in Ukraine might signal a toughening of the crackdown on dissent.

title: Leopard 2 and Challenger Tanks Arrive in Ukraine
description: The deliveries of advanced equipment are expected to assist Kyiv with a potential spring offensive.

title: Lawmakers Rebuke Biden for Bypassing Congress in Deal With Japan
description: The Democratic lawmakers called the Biden administration’s limited trade deal “unacceptable,” saying it should have been made available to Congress and the public for review.

title: Biden’s Defense of Global Democracies Is Tested by Political Turmoil
description: The administration’s Summit for Democracy begins this week amid crises in several countries allied with the United States, including Israel.

title: The I.O.C. defers discussion on whether Russian and Belarusian athletes will compete in the 2024 Olympics.
Belarus Says It’s Willing to Host Russian Nuclear Weapons
description: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia floated the idea of positioning nuclear weapons in Belarus last year, but recently raised the idea again, with more concrete details.

title: 2 Killed in Knife Attack at Ismaili Center in Lisbon, Portugal
description: The police shot and wounded the assailant at the Ismaili Center in Portugal’s capital. His motive was not immediately clear.

title: King Charles Will Travel to Germany for First Visit as Monarch
description: Charles is set to begin his trip on Wednesday. He had planned to start the royal tour in France, but that leg was canceled because of the country’s ongoing protests.

title: Netanyahu Opponents Used Dangers of ‘Reform’ by Autocrats to Sound Alarm
description: Pointing to examples of what happened after leaders elsewhere brought judiciaries to heel has helped mobilize Israelis in protest.

title: Father’s Conviction in Russia Determines Custody of His 12-Year-Old Daughter
description: Aleksei Moskalyov was convicted over antiwar comments on social media that came to light after his daughter made a drawing at school.

title: With Judicial Overhaul Paused, U.S. Offers Olive Branch to Netanyahu
description: News that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu had been invited to Washington came a day after the Israeli leader delayed plans to limit the power of the courts and signaled a calmer atmosphere.

title: Fire in Mexico Kills at Least 39 in Migration Center Near U.S. Border
description: The cause of the fire at the National Migration Institute in Ciudad Juárez, a border city near Texas, was not immediately clear.

title: Russia’s Push in Eastern Ukraine Leaves Avdiivka in Ruins
description: Moscow has struggled to capture new ground in eastern Ukraine but its bombardment has laid waste to cities and towns. Here is what we’re covering:

title: A Win for Israel’s Protesters
description: Demonstrations forced Israel’s prime minister to delay a judicial overhaul.

title: As King Charles Adjusts to Being Center Stage, So Do His Impersonators
description: Long overshadowed by other royal look-alikes, Charles imitators are experiencing newfound popularity ahead of the king’s coronation in May.

title: How to Lift the Fog of War in Ukraine? Try These Playing Cards.
description: To help soldiers quickly distinguish friend from foe, the Pentagon is issuing playing cards with pictures of 52 different NATO weapons systems.

title: Torture and Turmoil at Ukrainian Nuclear Plant: An Insider’s Account
description: The former director of Europe’s largest nuclear facility describes abuse of Ukrainian workers and careless practices by the Russians who took control of the plant.

title: France, Bracing for More Pension Protests, Is Stuck in a Standoff
description: Neither President Emmanuel Macron nor opponents of his pension overhaul were ready to back down on a new day of strikes and marches, with fears of rising anger and violence.

title: Elusive ‘Einstein’ Solves a Longstanding Math Problem
description: And it all began with a hobbyist “messing about and experimenting with shapes.”

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: A delay in Israel’s plan to overhaul the judiciary.

title: U.S. and Japan Reach Deal on Battery Minerals
description: While the terms of the deal are limited, the agreement appears to provide a model for resolving recent trade spats between the United States and some of its closest allies.

title: Inside the U.S. Pressure Campaign Over Israel’s Judicial Overhaul
description: President Biden and his advisers bombarded the Israeli government with warnings that the country’s image as the sole democracy in the Middle East was at stake.
